page.title: 11CORSTON WEST OF BATH
page.content: {Corston}is a small village to the West of Bath. All Saints Church is a big {church}and is still used regularly for services, weddings, christenings and funerals. The{school,}which was opened in 1884, was closed in 1984 as the number of children attending had dropped to 25 making it uneconomical to run. The village{shop}and the{Post {Office}are next to each other and are the only shops in the village.The {village hall}is used for all different kinds of social activities. St. Theresa's{Nursing Home}is where {elderly people}are cared for. There is a run_down{recreation ground}with only two swings and a slide_this is also used by the village football team. Corston is the home of a very well known{television personality}and the village people are very proud of this.
